definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: They're the SUVs of the animal kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 他們是動物界的休旅車。

sentences.english: Imitation is one of the most common and recognizable behaviors in the animal kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 模仿是動物界最常見和最容易認知的的行爲。

sentences.english: Codon usage varies throughout the animal and plant kingdoms.
sentences.chinese: 動物界和植物界密碼子使用頻率不同。

sentences.english: Feigning death occurs in a wide range of animal groups. This antipredator behavior enhances fitness of population in some species.
sentences.chinese: 假死行爲廣泛存在於動物界的各個類羣中。

sentences.english: The blue whale's whistle is the loudest noise made by an animal.
sentences.chinese: 藍鯨發出的口哨聲是動物界能發出最大的聲音。

sentences.english: Her theories on parenting and nurturing in carnivores have framed the debate.
sentences.chinese: 她在肉食動物界養育幼獸的理論成就非凡。

sentences.english: There's no way another animal does that, right?
sentences.chinese: 這在動物界絕對是不可能發生的吧？

definition: to keep up with the latest fashion
"The Ugly Duckling" by Hans Christian Andersen 安徒生[An1 tu2 sheng1]
reptiles/also written 爬行類|爬行类
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
